DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the decription medical device._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: Value for the parameter. When DIPARM = Type, DIVAL should be a value in the GMDN dictionary.

ReferenceDocuments.name: GMDN Dictionary
ReferenceDocuments.description: GMDN is a controlled vocabulary defined by FDA as Global Medical Device Nomenclature. The GMDN is not freely available to the public.  In the UDI rule, FDA indicated that GMDN will not be a requirement unless it is publically available at no cost.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CDISC Mapping task 7.13.18 mc
